data.enText: material made by weaving wool, cotton, silk, etc., used for making clothes, curtains, etc. and for covering furniture
the basic structure of a society, an organization, etc. that enables it to function successfully

data.chText: 威胁社会基本结构的趋势
data.enText: a trend which threatens the very fabric of society

data.chText: （建筑物的）结构（如墙、地面、屋顶）
data.enText: the basic structure of a building, such as the walls, floor and roof

data.chText: 以上各词均指织物、布料。
data.enText: These are all words for woven or knitted cotton, silk, wool, etc., used for making things such as clothes and curtains, and for covering furniture.
fabric used for making clothes, curtains, etc.

data.chText: “这件连衣裙是用什么料子做的？”“棉布。”
data.enText: ‘What material is this dress made of?’ ‘Cotton.’
woven or knitted cotton, silk, wool, etc., used for making things such as clothes and curtains, and for covering furniture

data.chText: fabric常指较结实的织物，常用于指盖家具、做窗帘的织物。
data.enText: Fabric is often fairly strong material, and is often used when talking about covering furniture or making curtains.
fabric made by weaving or knitting cotton, wool, silk, etc.

data.chText: 他的绷带是用布条做的。
data.enText: His bandages had been made from strips of cloth.

data.chText: cloth常指较轻的织物，尤指尚未印花、处理或未完成以供使用的织物。cloth常指买卖的织物、布料。material较fabric或cloth含义更广，因为该词含材料、原料等相关意义。不清楚布料类型就不用该词：
data.enText: Cloth is often fairly light material, especially in a form that has not been printed, treated, or prepared for use in any way. Cloth is frequently used in talking about buying and selling woven material. Material is a more general word than fabric or cloth as it has the related meaning of ‘a substance that things can be made from’. It is not used when it might not be clear which type of material is meant.
any type of fabric made by weaving or knitting

data.chText: 他拥有一家工厂，生产一系列纺织品。
data.enText: He owns a factory producing a range of textiles.

data.chText: textile多用于指生产织物的业务，生产纺织品的工业叫textiles：
data.enText: Textile is used mostly when talking about the business of making woven materials. The industry of making textiles is called textiles .

data.chText: 他在纺织行业找到一份工作。
data.enText: He got a job in textiles.

data.text: structure ♦ framework ♦ composition ♦ construction ♦ fabric ♦ make-up

data.chText: 以上各词均指事物各个不同部分的组合、构造。
data.enText: These are all words for the way the different parts of sth combine together or the way that sth has been made.
the way in which the parts of sth are connected together or arranged; a particular arrangement of parts
the structure of the building/human body
the grammatical structures of a language

data.chText: 指构成某个体系或社会基础的信仰、观点、准则：
data.enText: a set of beliefs, ideas or rules that forms the basis of a system or society

data.chText: 报告提供了进一步研究的原则。
data.enText: The report provides a framework for further research.

data.chText: 指不同部分或人的构成、组合方式：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) the different parts or people that combine to form sth; the way in which they combine

data.chText: 劳动力组合最近的变化
data.enText: recent changes in the composition of the workforce
the way that sth has been built or made

data.chText: 指社会、机构等的基本结构：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) the basic structure of a society or an organization that enables it to function successfully

data.chText: 这是威胁社会基本结构的趋势。
data.enText: This is a trend which threatens the very fabric of society .

data.chText: 指不同人或事物的构成、构成方式：
data.enText: the different people or things that combine to form sth; the way in which they combine
the genetic make-up of plants and animals

data.chText: 上述两词的主要区别在于使用场合的正式程度。composition较常用于科技语境，make-up则较常用于口语和新闻报道中。make-up亦指人的性格、气质。
data.enText: The main difference between these words is the level of formality. Composition is more often used in scientific and technical contexts; make-up is more often used in speech and journalism. Make-up also means the different qualities that combine to form sb's character.

simple_means.memory_skill: fabr 制作 + ic 某种药 → 织物

means: (建筑物的)结构(如墙、地面、屋顶)

ex.chText: 我们的设计人员创造出了一种新织物。
ex.enText: Our designers have created a new textile.
Gytha studies at the textile institute.

ex.chText: 他做纺织品生意很多年了。
ex.enText: He has been in the textile business for many years.

synonyms.bx: 指工业化大批生产的织物，尤用于制作服装。

ex.enText: Cloth is usually sold by the yard.

ex.chText: 棉布是由棉纺厂生产的。
ex.enText: Cotton cloth is made in a cotton mill.

ex.chText: 这种布有红蓝格子的图案。
ex.enText: This cloth has a pattern of red and blue squares.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用于制作服装的料子。

ex.chText: 我不喜欢那块布料上的图案。
ex.enText: I don't like the pattern on the fabric.

ex.chText: 这种纺织面料不掉色，不起皱。
ex.enText: This fabric is colour fast and wrinkle resistant.

ex.chText: 我想用这种毛料做套衣服。
ex.enText: I'd like to make a suit out of this woolen fabric.

synonyms.bx: 尤指用于制作服装、窗帘、家具覆盖物等的织物。

ex.chText: 做田径服需要用有弹性的料子。
ex.enText: For tracksuits you need stretchy material/fabric.

ex.chText: 这料子是单幅的还是双幅的？
ex.enText: Is the material/fabric single width or double width?

ex.chText: 她给靠垫蒙上了新的料子。
ex.enText: She covered the cushion with new material/fabric.

synonyms.bx: 与 fabric 同义，可换用，常称为料子。

tr: artifact made by weaving or felting or knitting or crocheting natural or synthetic fibers
example: the fabric in the curtains was light and semitransparent
woven cloth originated in Mesopotamia around 5000 BC
she measured off enough material for a dress
providing a factual framework for future research
it is part of the fabric of society

value.def: Fabric is cloth or other material produced by weaving together cotton, nylon, wool, silk, or other threads. Fabrics are used for making things such as clothes, curtains, and sheets.

example.ex: Whatever your colour scheme, there's a fabric to match.
example.tran: 无论什么样的色彩图案，都有与之相配的织物。

value.def: The fabric of a society or system is its basic structure, with all the customs and beliefs that make it work successfully.

example.ex: The fabric of society has been deeply damaged by the previous regime...
example.tran: 社会结构已遭到上届政府极大的破坏。

example.ex: Years of civil war have wrecked the country's infrastructure and destroyed its social fabric.
example.tran: 经年内战已破坏了国家的基础设施，摧毁了其社会结构。

value.def: The fabric of a building is its walls, roof, and the materials with which it is built.

example.ex: Condensation will eventually cause the fabric of the building to rot away.
example.tran: 冷凝作用将最终使建筑结构腐朽掉。

partsOfSpeech.dec: fabr 制作 + ic 某种药 → 织物
fabric 织物 + ate 做，造成，使… → 捏造；制作
pre 预先 + fabricat〔e〕捏造；制作 + ed 表形容词 → 预制的
